title: Clowns converge on Orlando for funny business
description: The World Clown Association is brining together all types of clowns for it's 40h annual convention.

title: Hyundai and Kia recall 571,000 vehicles due to fire risk, urge owners to park outside
description: Hyundai and Kia are telling the owners of more than 571,000 SUVs and minivans in the U.S. to park them outdoors because the tow hitch harnesses can catch fire while they are parked or being driven.

title: Georgia governor signs bill banning most gender-affirming care for trans children
description: The state will ban most gender-affirming surgeries and hormone replacement therapies for transgender people under 18 with a new bill signed into law by Gov. Brian Kemp.

title: South Carolina's comptroller quits after a $3.5 billion accounting error
description: Republican Comptroller General Richard Eckstrom's decision to leave the post he has held for 20 years came after scrutiny of his performance following the blunder in a year-end financial report.

title: In defense of fan fiction, and ignoring the 'pretensions of polish'
description: Fan fiction may not command the same respect as other literary pursuits, but it's a rich mode of expression, says one author who mounts a passionate case for the style.

title: NYC drag queen Linda Simpson reflects on the scene that set the stage for RuPaul
description: Linda Simpson performed in and chronicled the drag scene in the '80s and '90s, taking some 5,000 photos of performers. She calls Tennessee's anti-drag legislation "ridiculous."

title: Remembering Frank Griswold, an Episcopal bishop who championed gay rights
description: Griswold, who died March 5, presided over the ordination of the church's first openly gay bishop. That was one of the issues which nearly caused a schism in the church. Originally broadcast in 2006.

title: The Sweet 16 tips off Thursday, as the men's tourney continues a wild March
description: Any team that can put together a four-game winning streak will become the next champions. Only two No. 1 seeds are alive in the tournament, and the highest-profile schools have already gone home.

title: Why a horror film starring Winnie the Pooh has run into trouble in Hong Kong
description: The film featuring a murderous Pooh bear has been pulled from theaters in Hong Kong and Macau without explanation. Some say it's a result of China's censorship of memes related to leader Xi Jinping.

title: Michigan school shooter's parents can face trial for manslaughter, court rules
description: The parents of a teenager who killed four students at Oxford High School can face trial, the state appeals court said in a groundbreaking case of criminal responsibility for the acts of a child.

title: New York DA investigating Trump calls GOP requests 'unprecedented' and 'unlawful'
description: Three Republican House chairmen had demanded communiations, testimony and documents related to the investigation of the former president.

title: Suspect in Denver's East High School shooting is dead, authorities confirm
description: A 17-year-old student who shot two administrators at East High School on Wednesday has been found dead in a nearby county, local authorities said. One victim remains in critical condition.

title: GM will stop making the Chevy Camaro, but a successor may be in works
description: The Chevrolet Camaro, for decades the dream car of many teenage American males, is going out of production early next year. But General Motors says another generation may be in the works.

title: A rare tornado tears through part of Los Angeles County
description: The strongest tornado to impact the Los Angeles metro area in 40 years touched down at 11:14 a.m. for two to three minutes, according to the National Weather Service.

title: A 3D-printed rocket launched successfully but failed to reach orbit
description: A rocket made almost entirely of 3D-printed parts made its debut launch Wednesday night, passing a critical milestone. But it failed after three minutes of flight, crashing into the ocean.

title: 80-hour weeks and roaches near your cot? More medical residents unionize
description: Part of a national trend, medical residents at Penn Medicine in Philadelphia push to form a union to demand better working conditions and higher wages. Child care is an important issue for many.

title: It's not just Adderall: The number of drugs in short supply rose by 30% last year
description: A total of 295 types of drugs — everything from sedatives to children's flu medicine — were in short supply in 2022, according to a new report from the U.S. Senate Committee on Homeland Security.

title: FTC aims to making cancelling recurring charges easier with Click to Cancel
description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Lina Khan, head of the Federal Trade Commission, about a rule the agency is proposing that would make it easier to cancel memberships and subscriptions.

title: Still trying to quit that gym membership? The FTC is proposing a rule that could help
description: The Federal Trade Commission gets thousands of complaints a year from customers trapped in memberships they don't want. Its "Click to Cancel" proposal aims to change that, Chair Lina Khan tells NPR.

title: It's not just Stormy Daniels. Here are ongoing criminal investigations Trump faces
description: As a Manhattan grand jury hears evidence about the former president's involvement in a hush-money arrangement, he also faces scrutiny in other probes that could come with potential charges.

title: In fight over key surveillance law, officials look to sway congressional skeptics
description: A fight looms over warrantless collection of communication of foreigners overseas.

title: 3 reasons why California's drought isn't really over, despite all the rain
description: California has been deluged by storms this winter, but fixing the state's severe drought will take more than rain. The state had deeper problems in how it uses water.

title: A police officer in the Tyre Nichols case retired with benefits. That's not unusual
description: Lt. DeWayne Smith served as a supervisor on the now-deactivated SCORPION unit — the specialized police unit responsible for conducting the traffic stop that ultimately lead to Nichols' death.

title: Biden is visiting Ottawa this week. Concerns about Haiti are at the top of the agenda
description: It's President Biden's first trip to Canada as president. He and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau are expected to discuss their concerns about the security crisis in Haiti.

title: 5 planets could be visible in the night sky next week
description: On Monday and Tuesday, you may be able to catch a glimpse of Jupiter, Mercury, Venus, Uranus and Mars all at once.

title: It takes a few dollars and 8 minutes to create a deepfake. And that's only the start
description: Powerful artificial intelligence tools that can create video, audio, text, and pictures are raising fears the technology will supercharge disinformation and propaganda by bad actors.

title: Teetering banks put Biden between a bailout and a hard place ahead of the 2024 race
description: Voters hate bank bailouts. But letting them fail without a safety net for customers could have been even worse for President Biden ahead of the 2024 presidential race.

title: The fight over the debt ceiling could sink the economy. This is how we got here
description: Once upon a time, raising the nation's borrowing limit was considered a fairly routine vote. Today, Biden and the GOP are on a partisan collision course that risks landing the U.S. in default.

title: 6 things to know about U.S. teacher shortages and how to solve them
description: There are more teachers now than before the pandemic, so why did almost half of U.S. schools still have teacher vacancies weeks into this school year? Here's what to know.

title: Plot twist: Activists skirt book bans with guerrilla giveaways and pop-up libraries
description: This year is expected to set a record for the number of book bans by public school libraries, so many people are finding creative ways to make banned books available to young readers outside schools.

title: California could ban certain food additives due to concerns over health impacts
description: The bill would ban several common ingredients used in processed foods, such as Red Dye No. 3, which has been linked to cancer in animal studies.

title: Australia decides on the referendum question to create a greater say for Indigenous
description: Australians will vote sometime between October and December on the referendum that would enshrine in the constitution an Indigenous Voice to Parliament.

title: The SEC charges Lindsay Lohan, Jake Paul and others with illegally promoting crypto
description: Crypto entrepreneur Justin Sun and three of his companies were also charged with crimes related to the promotion and sale of two digital currencies, Tronix (TRX) and BitTorrent (BTT).

title: The prosecutor drops charges against 'Rick and Morty' co-creator Justin Roiland
description: The district attorney's office told NPR charges were dropped against Roiland "as a result of having insufficient evidence" to prove the case beyond a reasonable doubt.
